meanings.definition: A person or thing that modulates.
meanings.sent1: The music teacher was a skilled modulators of sound, adjusting the volume and tone effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The radio technician adjusted the modulators to improve the signal quality.
meanings.sent3: The modulators of flavors in the kitchen were the spices and herbs, creating a symphony of taste.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a modulators of emotions, brightening the room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush was a modulators, blending colors on the canvas with precision.

meanings.definition: An electronic device that varies the frequency, amplitude, or phase of a carrier wave in accordance with a signal.
meanings.sent1: The modulators in the lab were used to adjust the frequency of the radio waves.
meanings.sent2: The engineer installed the modulators to control the amplitude of the electrical signal.
meanings.sent3: The modulators in the spaceship malfunctioned, causing the communication signals to go haywire.
meanings.sent4: The modulators hummed softly, altering the phase of the wave with each adjustment.
meanings.sent5: The modulators glowed with a soft light, indicating they were in operation.
